channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK

item.title: Report X-2024021642
item.description:
Report X-2024021642

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS A UN SPECIFIED SINGLE WALL BOX CONTAINING 4 PLASTIC INNER BOTTLES SEPERATED BY CORRUGATED PARTITIONS. RESPONDER DISCOVERED ALL CAPS WERE LOOSE AND LEAKING SLIGHTLY. THE PACKAGE WAS WET, NO ADDITIONAL LIQUID AROUND THE BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024021408
item.description:
Report X-2024021408

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: BROKEN ARROW
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being loaded onto van. Loader noticed it was leaking, Vanline Manager notifieed QA ogf damaged Hazmat. Spill was cleaned and processed. DescribePack: Crack in pail is approx. 8" in bottom of pail DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in Hazmat bucket and placed in Hazmat cage under a vented hood.

item.title: Report X-2024021232
item.description:
Report X-2024021232

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found leaking during sort and was placed in a tote. During inspection, it was discovered that the contents were a hazmat and the wrong order. Because of this there was no hazmat labeling and a label that said not regulated as it was supposed to be not hazardous paint in the box. DescribePack: paint cans with loose lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in a tote and bag.

item.title: Report X-2024021444
item.description:
Report X-2024021444

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found at the back of van line 2. Upon discovery, I placed the package in a red hazmat tote. Container had been wet with closures open. The container had not been labeled as a hazardous materials package. Part of the hazardous contents spilled due to loose caps. Station 0660 OLAT damaged out, repacked, and RTS the package without completing the proper damaged hazmat processes. DescribePack: Container had been wet with closures open DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery, I placed the package in a red hazmat tote.
